revisions.rev:
{{See also|List of Olympic mascots}} Each [[Paralympic Games]] have a [[mascot]], usually an animal native to the area or occasionally human figures representing the cultural heritage. Nowadays, most of the merchandise aimed at young people focuses on the mascots, rather than the Paralympic flag or organization logos. The unnamed mascots of [[1980 Summer Paralympics]] in [[Arnhem]], The Netherlands are possibly the first Paralympic mascots. But since Komduri in the [[1988 Summer Paralympics]] in [[Seoul]], [[South Korea]], the Paralympic mascots has been associated with its Olympic counterparts. Nowadays, most of the merchandise aimed at young people focuses on the mascots, rather than the Paralympic flag or organization logos. ==List of mascots== {| class="wikitable" border="1" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 95%;" |- bgcolor="#efefef" ! width="170"|Paralympics !! City !! Mascot !! Character !! Designer !! Significance !! Picture |- |[[1980 Summer Paralympics]] || [[Arnhem]] || || a pair of [[squirrel]]s || ||Possibly the first Paralympic mascots when those Games were still called the World Disabled Games. | |- |[[1988 Summer Paralympics]] || [[Seoul]] || the "Komduri" || two [[Asian black bears]]. || || ||align="center"|[http://www.aldaver.com/Images/Po/ms1988pr.gif] |- |[[1992 Winter Paralympics]] || [[Tignes-Albertville]] || Alpy || A mountain on a mono-ski. || Vincent Thiebaut|| Represented the summit of the Grande Motte mountain in Tignes. Colors were white green and blue, to represent nature and the lake. ||align="center| |- |[[1992 Summer Paralympics]] || [[Barcelona]] || Petra || a stylized girl without arms || || ||align="center"|[http://www.aldaver.com/Images/Po/ms1992pr.gif] |- |[[1994 Winter Paralympics]] || [[Lillehammer]] || Sondre || troll, with an amputation || Tor Lindrupsen || The name was chosen in a competition and derives from the great skiing pioneer [[Sondre Nordheim]]. ||align="center"|[http://www.pinspal.com/images/W21.jpg] |- |[[1996 Summer Paralympics]] || [[Atlanta]] || Blaze || a colourful [[Phoenix (mythology)|phoenix]] || ||The phoenix is the symbol of the city of Atlanta. ||align="center"|[http://www.aldaver.com/Images/Po/ms1996pr.gif] |- |[[1998 Winter Paralympics]] || [[Nagano, Nagano|Nagano]] || Parabbit || a white [[rabbit]] (1 red & 1 green ear)[http://www.aldaver.com/ Olympic and Soccer Logos and Mascots], aldaver.com || || ||align="center"|[http://www.aldaver.com/Images/Po/ms1998pr.gif] |- |[[2000 Summer Paralympics]] || [[Sydney]] || Lizzie || [[Frill-necked Lizard]] || || Her frill was shaped like the combined islands of [[Australia]] and [[Tasmania]] ||align="center" |[http://images.beijing2008.cn/11/19/Img211621911.jpg] |- |[[2002 Winter Paralympics]] || [[Salt Lake City]] || Otto || [[otter]]||||The otter was chosen because it embodies vitality and agility; and some ancient Native American tribes considered the otter to be one of the most powerful of all animals. ||align="center" |[http://en.paralympic.beijing2008.cn/spirit/mascots/n214340625.shtml] |- |[[2004 Summer Paralympics]] || [[Athens]] || Proteas || colourfully-striped [[seahorse]] || || || [[Image:Proteas2004.jpg|120px]] |- |[[2006 Winter Paralympics]] || [[Turin]] || Aster || A humanized [[snowflake]] || || || [[Image:Paralympic games mascot Aster.jpg|120px]] |- |[[2008 Summer Paralympics]]|| [[Beijing]] || [[Fu Niu LeLe]] || Multi-coloured cow || [[Han Meilin]] || || [[Image:Fu Niu LeLe (mascot).jpg|120px|]] |- |rowspan=2| [[2010 Winter Paralympics]] ||rowspan=2| [[Vancouver]] || [[Miga, Quatchi, Sumi and Mukmuk|Sumi]] || A mythical creature ||rowspan=2| Meomi Design
(a group of
Vicki Wong and
Michael Murphy) || With wings of a [[Thunderbird (mythology)|Thunderbird]], legs of a [[American Black Bear|black bear]], and a hat of an [[orca whale]]. Part of Canadian legends. || [[Image:Sumi (mascot).jpg|120px|]] |- |[[Miga, Quatchi, Sumi and Mukmuk|Mukmuk]] || A [[Vancouver Island Marmot]] || Not an official mascot, but the designated "[[sidekick]]". ||align="center"|[http://www.vancouver2010.com/mascot/en/profile_mm.html] |- |[[2012 Summer Paralympics]] || [[London]] || [[Wenlock and Mandeville|Mandeville]]{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/olympic_games/london_2012/8690467.stm|title=BBC Sport - London 2012 unveils Games mascots Wenlock & Mandeville|last=Farquhar|first=Gordon|date=19 May 2010|work=[[BBC Online]]|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=19 May 2010}} || A drop of steel, painted blue by the rainbow || Irishttp://www.irisnation.com/irisnews/work/london-2012-mascots-launched-to-world/ || Named after the birthplace of the Paralympic Games, [[Stoke Mandeville Hospital]] in Buckinghamshire. || |- |[[2014 Winter Paralympics]] || [[Sochi]] || [[2014 Winter Olympic and Paralympic Games mascots|TBA]] || TBA || TBA || |- |[[2016 Summer Paralympics]] || [[Rio de Janeiro]] || TBA || TBA || TBA || |- |} ==See also== * [[Paralympic symbols]] * [[List of Olympic mascots|Olympic mascots]] * [[Olympic symbols]] ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Paralympic mascots| ]] [[zh:å¸ææå¹åéåæåç¥¥ç©åè¡¨]]
